intro: Dregea viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered dregea, is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces long, slender pods that contain seeds. Dregea viridiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
